0: Trick or treat! NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Seattle police say that two men wearing caricature masks resembling former President George W. Bush robbed a bank late Thursday afternoon. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Authorities said the men threatened employees with a gun, robbed the bank, and then left in a black four-door vehicle, according to KING-5 News. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Christopher Boffoli, a contributor to the West Seattle Blog, offered this description of the scene: NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The bank manager confirms the branch is closed for the rest of the day and as patrons have been showing up, they've been directed to use other branches. SPD detectives are on scene and are reviewing camera footage. They're also taking pictures in the alley north of the bank location. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Police described the suspects as two white males in their twenties. The FBI is investigating the possibility that this robbery could be connected to several other incidents in the area, including a Key Bank robbery on October 3 and a Wells Fargo robbery on September 12. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "George Bush" seems to be the go-to disguise for some bank robbers.
